title: Grilled Hot-and-sour Shrimp With Watermelon-watercress Salad
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free main course? Grilled Hot-and-sour Shrimp With Watermelon-watercress Salad could be a spectacular recipe to try. This recipe serves 4. For $3.11 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 273 calories, 25g of protein, and 9g of fat. A mixture of watermelon chunks, watercress, salt and pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. To use up the honey you could follow this main course with the Honey Gingerbread as a dessert. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 59%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Watermelon Salad with Grilled Shrimp, Curried-Shrimp Salad with Grilled Watermelon, and Watermelon and Watercress Salad.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 46 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Calcaire Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Bright yellow/gold color, quite luminous. Superb smoky toasty nose, typical for this grape on limestone in Alsace (no new oak in our wines, just very long total lees contact). Some light reductive aromas that actually fit the style of dry Pinot-Gris. The palate is rich and creamy, with a velvety texture yet fully dry. It is an easy wine to drink now as there is no unnecessary weight. The finish is nice and round but fully dry. The complex limestone blend brings great acid balance and a certain weight. It should develop very nicely over the next few years.
